The catcher can choose to stand at any point behind the net, generally standing diagonally opposite the driver. After the catcher is ready to prepare, the driver starts to serve. When serving, the player should throw the ball in any direction in the air by hand and then hit the ball with the racket before the ball falls. If the player is not satisfied with the action of throwing the ball, let the ball fall naturally and start over. However, if the player makes a shot with a racket but does not hit the ball, it is considered a serve error. The driver should not deviate from the original position during the serve. The driver's feet can leave the ground, but must not walk or run; this is to prevent deliberate misleading of the ball. Violation of this rule, or the deviation of the feet from the area, may constitute a violation.

fter the end of the game

paragraphs.context: A tennis game usually consists of one to five games, and each game is generally scored. The player who wins the first number of games wins the first game, and the player who wins the first number of games wins the game. In one game, only one player serves the ball, and the player who wins at least 4 points and has at least 2 points in the game wins one game. In a game, each serve must take turns in the two serve areas of the half. The first serve in each round should start from the right. The scoring method for each round of tennis is from zero to three, namely "zero", "fifteen", "thirty" and "forty". When scoring, the scorer's score is first. Therefore, "30 to 0" means that the player wins 2 points and the receiver has not scored. When both players get 3 points, they are generally called "draw" instead of "40 to 40." After a draw, a player scores another point and is called "preemptive" instead of scoring. If you lose a point in the first case, you will return to the tie again; if you get one more point, you will win a game. The driver is the first to take the lead, or if he is 2 points or more ahead of the opponent, it is called the "point". If the catcher is in a similar situation, it is called a "break point." Before each serve, the referee should verbally report the score of this game. In the absence of a referee, the driver should report the score.

paragraphs.context: Since temperature affects physical quantities such as volume, density, speed of sound, and impedance, temperature can be measured by measuring changes in the values of these physical quantities. At present, there are dozens of methods for temperature measurement. According to the measurement principle, it can be divided into the following categories: expansion temperature measurement method, which uses geometric quantity as a symbol of temperature. For example, the measurement range of a mercury thermometer is about -30 to 300 ° C, and the measurement range of an alcohol thermometer is about -115 to 110 ° C. The electrical temperature measurement method uses some electrical quantity such as a resistance change with temperature as a temperature mark. Resistance thermometers are mostly used below 600 ° C, thermocouple thermometer measurement range is generally below 1600 ° C, in addition to semiconductor thermistor thermometer. The magnetic temperature measurement method measures the temperature according to the relationship between the magnetic susceptibility of the paramagnetic substance and the temperature, and is commonly used in ultra-low temperature measurement. Acoustic temperature measurement, using the speed of sound as a temperature mark. Mainly used for the determination of thermodynamic temperature at low temperatures. The frequency temperature measurement method measures the temperature according to the change of the natural frequency of the object. The resolution of a quartz crystal thermometer can reach one ten thousandth of a degree Celsius. The optical temperature measurement method measures the temperature based on black body radiation. Such as infrared thermometers. Density temperature measurement methods, such as Galileo thermometers.

paragraphs.context: Leshan City is a prefecture-level city under the jurisdiction of Sichuan Province of the People's Republic of China. It is located in the south-central part of Sichuan Province and was called Jiazhou in ancient times. The city borders Zigong City and Yibin City in the east, Liangshan Prefecture in the south, Ya'an City in the west and Meishan City in the north. It is located in the southwest of the Sichuan Basin, the Chengdu Plain in the north, the Chuanzhong Hilly Area in the east, and the Xiaoliangshan Mountain in the southwest. The terrain is high in the southwest and low in the northeast. The Minjiang River runs from north to south and merges with Dadu River and Qingyi River in the urban area, and then flows out to the southeast. The total area is 12,700 square kilometers and the population is 3,260,500. Leshan is a national historical and cultural city and an excellent tourist city in China. The famous Leshan Giant Buddha is located on the south side of Lingyun Temple on the east bank of the Minjiang River. Emei Mountain, one of the four famous Buddhist mountains in China, is located in the northwest of the city. Leshan has a long history and was ruled by Kaiwang Kaiming more than 2,000 years ago. The Han Dynasty set up Nan'an County. North Zhou Dynasty set up Emei County, Pingyi County. In the nine years of the reign of Emperor Sui Dynasty, Emei County was changed to Qingyi County. In the tenth year of Kaihuang, Qingyi County was changed to Longyou County. In the thirteenth year of Kaihuang, he set up Emei County. Longyou County in the Tang Dynasty was governed by Jiazhou Prefecture. During the Song Dynasty, Jiading House was relocated. During the Yuan Dynasty, the Jiadingfu Road was changed. During the Ming Dynasty, it was changed to Jiading Zhilizhou. In the 12th year of Emperor Yongzheng of the Qing Dynasty, it was restored to Jiading Prefecture and set up in Leshan County. Jiading Prefecture claims to have the name of Leshan in the county, but where the Leshan is in the county, the sayings vary. Jiading House is not the same as this Leshan City jurisdiction.

paragraphs.context: Genetic engineering is a group of genetic material technologies that use biotechnology to directly manipulate the genome of an organism and use it to alter cells. Gene transfer from the same species and across species is included to produce improved or new organisms. New genetic material can be inserted into the host genome by isolating and replicating the desired genetic material using molecular replication techniques to produce DNA sequences, or by synthesizing DNA and then inserting into the host organism. Nucleases can be used to remove or knock out genes. Gene targeting is a different technique for using homologous recombination to alter endogenous genes, and can be used to delete genes, remove exons, add genes, or introduce point mutations. An organism produced by genetic engineering is considered to be a genetically transformed organism. The first gene-transforming organism was a bacterium produced in 1973 and a genetically-transferred mouse in 1974. Insulin-producing bacteria were commercialized in 1982, and genetically modified foods have been sold since 1994. GloFish, the first genetically engineered organism designed as a pet, was first sold in the United States in December 2003. Genetic engineering techniques have been applied in many fields, including research, agriculture, industrial biotechnology, and medicine. Enzymes for laundry detergents and drugs such as insulin and human growth hormone are now produced in gene transfer cells, experimental gene transfer cell lines and gene transfer animals such as mice or zebrafish are being used for research purposes, and genes The transfer crop has been commercialized.

paragraphs.context: In medicine, genetic engineering has been used to make drugs, build model animals, conduct laboratory research and gene therapy. Genetic engineering is used for large-scale production of insulin, growth hormone, human albumin, monoclonal antibodies, coagulation factors, and vaccines. Mouse hybridomas, cells fused together to produce monoclonal antibodies have been humanized by genetic engineering to produce human monoclonal antibodies. Genetically engineered viruses are being developed that still confer immunity but lack infection sequences. Genetic engineering is used to establish animal models of human disease. Gene-transferred mice are the most common genetically engineered animal models. They have been used in cancer, obesity, heart disease, diabetes, arthritis, drug addiction, anxiety, aging, Parkinson's disease research and simulation. Potential therapies can be tested against these mouse models. In the process of increasing the success rate of organ transplantation, genetically-transferred pigs were cultivated.

paragraphs.context: Genetic engineering is a technique used to alter the genetic composition of an organism, including the deletion of heritable materials, and the incorporation of DNA directly prepared in vitro into a host or cell, followed by fusion or hybridization with the host. This involves the use of recombinant nucleic acid technology to form new combinations of heritable genetic material, which are then directly incorporated into the material by indirect or by microinjection, bulk injection and microencapsulation techniques. Genetic engineering typically does not include traditional animal and plant breeding, in vitro fertilization, multiple sports, artificial mutagenesis, and cell fusion techniques, as recombinant nucleic acids or genetically modified organisms are not used in the process. However, the European Union also broadly defines genetic engineering as including selective breeding and other means of manual selection. Replication and stem cell technology, although not considered to be genetic engineering, are also closely related to genetic engineering, in which genetic engineering can be used. Synthetic biology is an emerging discipline that enables genetic engineering to further introduce synthetic materials from raw materials into living organisms.

paragraphs.context: In political economy, production refers to the use of labor, that is, with the assistance of capital, to create certain identifiable things that are usable. The study of production relations is very important for political economy, because economists only recognize the overall demand, but there are always specific resources that will become the bottleneck of production. Political activities focus on securing resources that create bottlenecks. Political economy regards production as the central activity of the economy and regards labor as the ultimate bottleneck of government behavior. The government must use existing labor resources to meet demand and have sufficient capital to ensure that labor is effective. In Adam Smith's theory of national wealth, the basic formula of political economy is expressed as: capital-investment-consumption=surplus or deficit capital is a function of labor as a parameter. Investment is the capital needed for production, and consumption is the use of the product. If the state has a fiscal surplus, it will purchase materials, invest or consume. If the total amount of state investment and consumption is greater than its output, there will be a fiscal deficit, then it must be sold out of assets or borrowed to balance. Research on production focuses on the broad interaction between capital and labor. Because labor must rely on capital, with certain skills and money.

paragraphs.context: Railway transportation, commonly known as rail transportation or rail transit. In a narrow sense, it usually refers to a way of transporting a vehicle with wheelsets along a railway track to achieve the purpose of transporting passengers or cargo. The generalized railway transportation also includes maglev trains, cable cars, ropeways, etc., which are not in the form of wheels, but still operate along specific tracks. In mainland China, rail transit generally refers to urban rail transit and intercity rail transit. According to the national standard of urban rail transit technical regulations of the People's Republic of China, urban rail transit is defined as: urban public passenger transport system using dedicated orbital guidance, including subway system, light rail system, monorail system, tram, maglev system, automatic guidance Track system, city fast track system. Its English translation is urban rail transit. Rail transport is one of the most convenient ways of land transportation. The rails provide a very smooth and rigid medium for the wheels of the train to roll with minimal friction. The people above will feel more comfortable and save energy. If properly configured, rail transport can save five to seventy percent of energy when carrying the same weight than road transport. Moreover, the rails can evenly distribute the weight of the train, which greatly increases the load capacity of the train. And safe and comfortable. paragraphs.context: In 1832, James Bowman Lindsay demonstrated the use of water to convey radiograms to students in the classroom. In 1948, Xia Nong, who worked at Bell Labs at the time, published the mathematical principles of the paper communication. This iconic paper created a mathematical theory method for analyzing communication systems, namely information theory. Information theory allows us to extrapolate the capacity based on the channel's bandwidth and signal-to-noise ratio characteristics. In the era of paper publication, telecommunications systems are mainly based on analog circuits. Since then, with the proliferation of digital integrated circuits, the design of telecommunication systems can make full use of the theoretical guidance of information theory to improve performance. As a result, digital signal processing has also become a new field. The basic elements that make up a communication system include transmitters, channels, and receivers. The transmitter is responsible for encoding or converting the information into a signal suitable for transmission. The signal is transmitted to the receiver through the channel. During the transmission process, the signal is inevitably changed due to the presence of noise. The receiver side attempts to apply the appropriate decoding means to recover the information from the degraded signal. An important indicator for describing a channel is bandwidth. The structure of the communication system can be point-to-point or point-to-multipoint, and broadcasting is a special form of point-to-multipoint propagation.

Adapting to a completely different original environment may be quite different from adapting to the current environment. Poverty is also linked to the risk of suicide. paragraphs.context: Scientific methods refer to a set of techniques used to examine natural phenomena, acquire new knowledge, or modify and integrate previously acquired knowledge. Based on the results of the test, the hypothesis being examined may need to be improved or resolutely rejected. Then, a scientific theory can be announced. . The scientific approach involves many steps. Then design experiments to test these hypotheses and check whether the predictions given from these hypotheses are correct. In order to prevent errors or misunderstandings during the experiment, these steps must be repeatable. Before a hypothesis is widely accepted by the academic community, it must first be compared with the experimental data in a sensible way through the rigorous verification of scientific methods. paragraphs.context: In 1451, Ottoman Sultan Murad II died of a stroke, and Muhammad II took the throne. He was determined to capture Constantinople and completely destroy the Eastern Roman Empire. In November of the same year, he signed a treaty with the Hungarian king, in exchange for the establishment of a new fortress on the Danube in exchange for Hungary's neutrality. These treaties are valid for three years, which means that they will be able to attack Constantinople without any interference during these three years. In the past, the Ottoman Empire believed that the attack on Constantinople was too costly and not worth it. The walls of Constantinople are very strong, and no one in the millennium can overcome it except for the Crusaders. But with the advent of the gun, this wall could no longer protect the city. The Hungarian engineer Urban, who provided a huge cannon, was powerful enough to break the walls of Constantinople. At the beginning of March 1453, Muhammad II began to transport the siege guns outside the city of Constantinople. On Thursday, April 5, the Ottoman army appeared on the plain outside the walls of Constantinople. The next day was the Muslim’s main day, and Muhammad ordered the unwinding of the cannon. The final battle with the Eastern Roman Empire began. The defenders of Constantinople miraculously repelled many attacks, but after two months of shelling, the walls were smashed in many places. In the total decisive battle on May 29, the Ottoman army rushed into Constantinople, and the last emperor of the Roman Empire, Constantine XI, died in battle. On the morning of May 30, Muhammad II entered Constantinople and the Eastern Roman Empire died. Muhammad II saw himself as the heir to the Roman Empire. In 1461, the Trabzon Empire, ruled by the last royal family of the Eastern Roman Empire, was also occupied by Muhammad II. paragraphs.context: Eastern Roman architecture can be divided into three phases, namely, early, middle and late. The early period was the prosperous period of the Eastern Roman architecture. Most of the architectural works were modeled after the Romanesque style. The main buildings include the walls of Constantinople, gates, palaces, squares, arches, elevated waterways, public baths and reservoirs, and churches. After Christianity became the state religion, the church buildings in East Rome grew larger and more luxurious. By the 6th century AD, the unprecedented spectacular Hagia Sophia finally appeared. The Middle Roman architecture reflects the national characteristics of this period, that is, the foreign invasion of the barbarians, the loss of territory, and the decline of national strength. The architecture of this period has shrunk and the scale is not as good as it used to be. The architecture of the Eastern Roman Church during this period was characterized by a small footprint and development in the air. There was no central amnesty like the Hagia Sophia, replaced by a number of small cymbals and with a focus on interior decoration. Representative buildings of this period include the Acatalepthos Monastery in Constantinople, the Chora Monastery, and the San Marco Church in Venice outside the Empire and the Church of St. Sophia in Kiev. After the Fourth Crusade in 1204 captured Constantinople and slaughtered, the Byzantine national power suffered a great loss and was unable to build large public buildings and churches. The number of East Roman buildings built during this period was small and there was no innovation. After the Ottoman Empire annihilated the Byzantine Empire, most of it was damaged. The Church of St. Mary of Constantinople is a representative work of the late Eastern Roman architecture. The East Roman architecture is a masonry structure with concrete in some places. From the architectural elements, the East Roman architecture contains the veneer vaults of ancient West Asia, the classical columns of ancient Greece and the grand scale of ancient Roman architecture, and the architectural form of Basilica. The arches and plaques of the East Roman architecture are mostly in the form of small thick seams to reduce the weight of the vault. From the existing sites, some of the individual buildings in Byzantium's palaces and other public buildings have a central axis symmetry, but the entire building group is composed of buildings that are randomly added during each period, presenting a plane-free irregular layout. In addition, there is a big gap between Byzantine architecture and classical Greek and Roman architecture: classical architecture pursues the overall coordination of vipassana and appearance, and there is no such thing as a simple, visually broken geometric balance in religious architecture, while Byzantine architecture Basically abandoned the aesthetic pursuit of the building, even the Hagia Sophia, in appearance, is nothing but a decorative, bloated red brick shape, only to enter the interior, can bring the clever combination of Qianlong and dome The sense of lightness and grandeur, as well as the brilliant brilliance of the brilliant lighting and colorful decoration.

paragraphs.context: The Byzantine Empire is located in a warm and humid Mediterranean climate zone, and the climate largely determines the diet and habits of the Eastern Romans. According to "An Food on the East" written by an anonymous Eastern Roman writer, the Eastern Romans in different regions have slightly different diets, but the staple foods are basically bread and beans. In the capital, Constantinople, due to the high price of meat, the staple foods of ordinary people are bread, olives, onions, lentils, cheese and fish. In the field, cattle, sheep, pigs, horses, chickens, ducks, geese and other poultry meats are widely consumed. Constantinople people like to eat sea fish, freshwater fish are usually used to feed cats and dogs. Other vegetables mentioned in the Byzantine historical materials include radish, cabbage, garlic, onion, pumpkin, lettuce, leeks, cucumbers, spices including sesame, alfalfa, pepper, cloves, and apples, figs, watermelons, apricots and grapes. the Lord. Drinks are home-brewed wines and beers. Olive oil is added to almost all foods. The food produced in various places mainly meets the local needs. The capital and the big cities like Thessaloniki and Antioch rely on imported food and the government's granary allocation. After the loss of Egypt, Libya, and the northern Atlas Mountains in Algeria, Afrika, and Syria in the early 7th century, cereal production decreased, meat consumption began to increase, and wool and linen replaced cotton from Egypt. The main raw material. The costumes of the Eastern Romans also vary from region to region, and the cold and rainy Macedonia and Danube borders in winter are quite different from the arid and hot Egyptian regions. Silk is a royal monopoly of raw materials, silk production is concentrated in the southern part of Greece, and the sale of silk is strictly controlled by official businessmen. Without the permission of the royal family, civilians are not allowed to wear silk clothing at will. The purple silk gown is dedicated to the emperor and the empress, while the high-ranking churches wear brocade robes and vestments. Ordinary people's clothing is mostly made of cotton and linen. From the existing East Roman painting hand scroll, in the 1100's history of the Empire, the clothing style is basically brisk, thin Mediterranean style, the main clothing styles include robes and shawls. , waist cloth, leather boots. The primary entertainment of the East Romans is to watch competitive competitions. The competition includes two-wheeled horse racing, hunting, wrestling, beasts, acrobatics and clown performances. However, due to the influence of Christian doctrine, the cruel, fighting and slave fighting performances of the Roman era at the expense of the participants’ lives have disappeared. Other forms of entertainment include gambling, music, outings, watching comedy and burlesque. The Queen of the Justinian I, Theodora, was once a burlesque actor and her father was a bearer. The sex service industry in Constantinople and other commercial cities is also very developed. However, the Byzantine Empire is strictly monogamous in accordance with Christian doctrine. The minimum age for marriage is 14 for men and 12 for women.

paragraphs.context: After the 7th century AD, the international trade of the Byzantine Empire was affected by the war with the Sassanid and Arab. The traditional trade route through Syria, Mesopotamia and the Persian Gulf was interrupted, forcing East Rome to enter the Indian Ocean through the Red Sea. The sea trade and the land trade routes through the Black Sea, the Kasa Khan, the Caspian Sea and the Aral Sea. By the 9th century, the international trade of the empire reached its peak. In 1071, the Turks captured Asia Minor. Although it was basically recovered in 1143, the Byzantine Empire gradually lost its commercial base on the Black Sea coast. At the same time, the business of East Rome began to decline due to the rise of Venice and the competition of merchants in Genoa and Catalonia. The Normans invaded the silk industrial centers such as Thebes and Collins in southern Greece, bringing a large number of sericulture technicians and silk craftsmen to Sicily, breaking East Mono's monopoly on silk. Several Crusades, especially the Fourth Crusade on April 13, 1204, captured Constantinople and slaughter, severely ruining the commercial status of the Empire and completely changing the Mediterranean trade pattern. In the several royal struggles of the late Byzantine Empire, in order to obtain funds, the Eastern Roman contenders were repeatedly privileged by commercial trade privileges, causing the already severely damaged domestic business to become more difficult. Constantinople and Trabzon are no longer the distribution center for oriental goods, and their status was taken away by Venice's commercial base in the Eastern Mediterranean. Venetian and Genoese merchants even gained commercial privilege in East Rome, establishing a commercial colony in Galata on the outskirts of Constantinople. By the 14th century, Byzantine’s business had completely shrunk. In addition to commercial taxes, other sources of income for the Byzantine Empire include property taxes imposed on the elite and tax taxes imposed on urban business owners. In addition, the city’s industrial and commercial owners are also levied taxes on horses and cloth. Urban citizens are also required to pay indirect taxes such as notarization, stamping, and judicial taxes. Rich citizens also have to pay for street lamp fuel, festival horse racing, charity, urban sanitation and fire fighting. The agricultural tax in East Rome is collected collectively from the village according to the area of the field, and the tax required for the barren farmland thrown by the fugitive farmers is paid by the village where it is located. In May and September each year, the empire's circuit judges and tax officials go to the countryside to levy taxes, and the land status is censused every three years to determine the tax amount.

paragraphs.context: Another dividing line in the history of East Rome is the 378-year Battle of Adrian Fort. This defeat and the death of Emperor Valence can be seen as the time between the ancient empire and the medieval empire. The heir of Valence, Theodosius I, separated the entire empire again. In 395 he handed over the two parts to his two sons, Arcadios and Honorius. Arcadios became the ruler of the East, and he was scheduled to be in Constantinople; Honorius became the ruler of the West, and his capital was Milan. From this time on, the empire in the east is generally known as the Eastern Roman Empire. The Eastern Roman Empire basically avoided the catastrophe suffered by the Western Roman Empire in the third and fourth centuries. There are many reasons for this. First of all, the urban culture of East Rome is quite mature. Secondly, when the nationality migrated, the main attraction of the barbarian invasion was the wealth of Rome. In the 5th century, the Western Roman Empire was repeatedly invaded and looted. The Eastern Roman Empire often avoided the catastrophe as long as it contributed. Theodosius II strengthened the walls of Constantinople, making the city a city that the barbarians could not break. In 476, when the Western Roman Empire died, Leo I of the Eastern Roman Empire negotiated with the Visigoths. He ended the threat of the Visigoths to the Eastern Empire, but he no longer intended to conquer the Western Empire.

paragraphs.context: The misfortune is that a few fierce plagues also attacked the territory of the Eastern Roman Empire. The plague of the 541 spring caused the first devastating blow to the empire. The plague began in the Nile River, destroying one-third of the empire's population. In Constantinople alone, more than half of the citizens died. According to the records of the East Roman history official, there were not enough people to bury the dead: the piles of bodies were thrown into the burial pit, the princess was buried with the eunuch, the priest and the niece were buried, and the guards were buried with the shackles. The public cemetery was quickly filled, and the emperor ordered the roof of all the towers on the wall of Galata City to be thrown away. The body was thrown in from above and filled with a top. Soon, all the towers were filled with corpses, and the dead were buried in the sea. Some of the bodies have rotted and stuck with the mat, and a yellow-brown pus floating on the Golden Horn. The speed of the sea-going shuttle cannot keep up with the speed at which the citizens have passed away, and the sea burial is too late. In the fall of 541, the plague disappeared. However, in the next 70 years, it broke out several times, destroying the taxation and the source of the soldiers of the Eastern Roman Empire, and the currency of the Eastern Roman Empire was on the verge of collapse. In 615, the Avar's army stormed into the empire and continued to move to places just a few miles away from Constantinople. In Asia, the Eastern Roman Empire was attacked by the Sassanid dynasty in the Middle Persia region. The loss of territory also quickly led to a reduction in the food supply of Constantinople. In 618, the policy of distributing bread to the Roman citizens of the capital Constantinople was terminated. At this time, three-quarters of the territory of the original Eastern Roman Empire has been lost: Levante on the east coast of the Mediterranean, Egypt, Libya, and Asia Minor, except the northern and southern sections of the Mediterranean, have fallen into Kuss II of Elan Shahr The hands of Thrace, Greece, and Italy were occupied by the Slavs, the Avars, and the Lombards. The Avar and the Yilan kingdoms were eager to see the East Roman Empire. On October 6, the Republic of China, October 6, The urban area is divided into the second district such as the eastern district and the western district. Chiayi City is located at the northern end of the Jianan Plain in southwestern Taiwan. The city is north of the Tropic of Cancer. Except for the part of the eastern part of the Zhuqiqiu hilly area, the rest are fertile plains. The terrain descends from east to west, and the terrain is flat and wide. It is located in Jianan. The edge of the Meishan fault zone in the plains. About one-third of the area in the east is a gently sloping hilly terrain above 50 meters, and the remaining two-thirds of the area is a flat below 50 meters, which is the scope of the Jianan Plain. The main rivers in Chiayi City have Bazhangxi in the south and Puzixi in the north, all originating from the Central Mountain Range and forming a natural boundary with Chiayi County. Because the composition of the Jianan Plain is composed of very fine silt and clay, the water content is poor. The groundwater content is not abundant, and the water resources mainly depend on the supply of the Lantan and Renyitan two reservoirs from Bazhangxi. The center of Chiayi is located in the north latitude 23°29′ and the east longitude 120°27′, which belongs to the subtropical monsoon climate. The annual temperature is the highest in July, the lowest in January, and the annual average temperature is 23.8 degrees Celsius. Although it is located in southern Taiwan, it has a low temperature below 10 degrees Celsius due to the strong radiation cooling effect of the Jianan Plain during the winter cold weather. Before the establishment of the Chiayi Weather Station, there was a subzero low temperature, leaving no observation record; For the dry season, the northeast monsoon is dominant; the southwest wind is prevalent in summer, the wind is gentle, and the high temperature and convection are strong. There are often thunderstorms in the afternoon; typhoons often occur between July and September. The average annual rainfall in Chiayi City is 1696.9 mm.

Chiayi City is located in the Jianan Plain. The climate is between the tropical and subtropical boundaries. The alluvial plain and warm climate are quite suitable for crop growth. The agriculture of Chiayi City was greatly increased in 1721, when Zhou Zhongyu, who was then the order of Zhuluo County, built a water conservancy facility. At that time, Lan Tingzhen, who came to Taiping to settle Zhu Yigui’s incident, had a slogan of Lan Dingyuan’s words: Before this, Taiwan’s Zhifu ruled for more than a hundred miles, Fengshan and Zhulu were poisonous and sinister, so that their deaf people still dare not come; today Then the South is full of Langjiao, the northern poor fresh water, the chicken cage is more than a thousand hundred miles, the people tend to squat. It shows the power of water conservancy. After Kangxi, the Han people mainly planted dry crops in the Chiayi area, including rice, alfalfa, winter wheat, beans and hemp. Usually cattle, pigs, goats, chickens and ducks are sideline. Although agricultural reclamation has increased food production, it has also oppressed the living space of the local Hongya indigenous people and has a certain impact on the natural ecology. After the Japanese occupation, the Chiayi City agriculture under the incentive production policy, coupled with agricultural technology improvement and variety research, agricultural product quality and unit area output have increased significantly. The planting ratio of economic crops in Chiayi City during the Japanese occupation period is quite high, and the varieties include fresh fruits and vegetables such as sugar cane, pineapple, banana, longan, lotus, and vegetables. Taiwan's agriculture during the Japanese occupation period has introduced modern agricultural machinery for arable land, irrigation, rice processing or oil production. In the prevention and control of pests and diseases, the Governor's Office of Taiwan and the Sugar Society sent pest inspectors to inspect them to help farmers fight pests.

paragraphs.context: For thousands of years, electricity was only a curious wisdom of scholars. Until 1600, due to the rigorous academic attitude of William Gilbert, systematic research on the phenomenon of electricity and magnetism began. Gilbert is the royal doctor of Queen Elizabeth I. He is particularly interested in electricity and magnetism. He wrote the first scientific book on Magnetism and Magnetism. This is a book with a modern scientific spirit that focuses on the results of the experiment. Gilbert pointed out that amber is not the only substance that can generate static electricity through friction. Diamonds, sapphires, glass, etc. can also demonstrate the same electrical properties. Here, he succeeded in breaking the attraction of amber. Nature This continues the misconception of 2000. Electrostatic electroscopes made by Gilbert can detect electrostatic charges with a keen sense. In the following century, this is the best instrument for detecting electrostatic charges. Previously, the Italian mathematician and doctor Girolamo Cardano listed the differences between electrical and magnetic phenomena. From the results of Cardano, Gilbert got a lot of inspiration, he proposed more differences: charged substances will attract all other substances, and magnets will only attract iron; amber needs friction to produce electricity, and magnets do not need Any action; magnets will align objects in a certain orientation, while charged materials will only attract other substances. Gilbert created the new Latin term electrica, which means something like the way amber attracts. Because of his many contributions to electricity, Gilbert was honored as the father of electricity by future generations. Later, the English word electric and electricity were derived from electricus. These two English words first appeared in Thomas Brown's 1646 book "Worldly Paradox". Later, scientists Otto von Glick, Robert Boyle, Steven Gray, Charlie Duffe, etc., have done further research.

paragraphs.context: In June 1752, self-taught Benjamin Franklin made a famous kite experiment in ancient and modern times; he and his son flew a kite in the thunderstorm, attracted lightning from the air, and tied a metal key at the other end of the kite line. Between Franklin's hand, a series of electric flowers were produced, and he felt the taste of hemp at the same time, which confirmed that lightning is a phenomenon of electricity. Franklin also experimented with the law of conservation of charge, that is, in any isolated system, the total amount of electricity does not change. In 1767, Joseph Priestley experimented and found that within the charged metal container, the electrical force was zero. From the results of this experiment, he accurately guessed that the attraction and the gravitational attraction of charged objects to each other obey the same law. In 1785, Charles Coulomb experimented with a torsion balance to confirm Priestley's guess that the force exerted by two charged objects on each other is inversely proportional to the distance. He laid the basic law of static electricity, Coulomb's law. Here, research in electricity has been promoted to become an accurate science. In 1791, Luigi Galvani discovered that if the frog and the electrostatic generator were connected into a closed circuit and then the electrostatic generator was turned on, the frog muscles would vibrate. This experiment demonstrates that nerve cells rely on electrical media to transmit signals to the muscles. He thus created the field of bioelectrical science. In 1800, Count Alexandra Volta immersed copper and zinc in salt water and connected the wires to make the first battery: the voltaic battery, which is the ancestor of modern batteries. Volta batteries give scientists a more stable power source than electrostatic generators that continuously supply current.

However, the battery stores limited energy and must be recharged or discarded whenever the stored energy is used up. The shape of this generator is nothing like the same-pole generator that Faraday invented earlier. However, the operating principle on which it is based is still Faraday's law. The invention of transformers in the late nineteenth century increased power transmission efficiency in a high voltage, low current manner; this means that power generation functions can be concentrated in a centrally located power plant. paragraphs.context: Northern Cyprus, controlled by Turkey in 1975, announced the establishment of the Cyprus Confederation of Cyprus, which was changed to the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus on November 15, 1983. North Cyprus has not yet received international recognition. Only Turkey recognizes its sovereignty, but actually has the actual dominance of the northern half of the island. Under this circumstance, Turkey does not recognize the Cyprus government’s sovereignty over the island. The Greek regime that called the government of the Republic of Cyprus, South Cyprus. In contrast, the Republic of Cyprus in the south of the island still holds international recognition including the membership of the United Nations, but because of the lack of participation of representatives of the Turkish descent in its congress, it cannot meet the norms of the original national constitution, and therefore cannot be completely Represents the position of the entire Cyprus. In order to solve the split problem of Cyprus, the international community represented by the United Nations for a long time has always tried to find a solution. Under the mediation of UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan, a referendum called Annan’s plan was implemented on April 24, 2004. Annan plans to combine the northern and southern half of Cypress with a state structure similar to Bosnia and Herzegovina to form the United Republic of Cyprus, however, Through the smooth restructuring of this plan, the referendum, which is required to be held at the same time on both sides of the North and the South, agrees that this proposal can be established. In fact, the result of the vote was that residents of North Cyprus generally accepted the plan of Annan, and adopted the proposal by 64.9%. However, the Greek ethnic group of South Cyprus strongly opposed the proposal and cast it. Up to 75.83% of the negative, Annan plans to fail. The reason why the Greek community and the Government of the Republic of Cyprus objected was that the content of Annan’s plan continued the spirit of the constitution enacted in the United Kingdom and was intended to protect the rights of the Turks, although both the United Nations and the European Union expressed this result. Regrettably, based on the democratic spirit of the people’s self-determination, it is still necessary to accept the current results and find another solution.

paragraphs.context: The Oscar for Best Picture Award, voted by industry insiders from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, was awarded to one of the highest-rated films in the year, the Academy Awards. This award was originally called the Best Works Award. At the first Oscar, two of the best film awards were presented, one of the best works was awarded to the epic film "Iron Wings", and another outstanding work award was awarded to the art film "Sunrise". Both of these awards were awarded to the most outstanding films of the year, and their performances were different but equally good. In fact, the judges and film owners have changed their film awards with their influence. MGM boss Louis B. Mayer reluctantly awarded the award to "Sunrise" because he did not like the realism of "The Masses" by his company's Kim Vido. The following year, Oscar changed back to the single best work award and decided that "Iron Wings" was the award-winning film of this award, and that "Iron Wings" was always mistaken for the first best film of the year. After years of development, in 1944, Oscar limited the number of nominations for the best film award to five. Since 2010, the number of nominations has been expanded to 10. Some people think that non-English films will only be selected for the best foreign language films. That is to say, only a very small number of non-English films can be selected for other awards other than the best foreign language films because of their artistic value. Therefore, the Oscar for Best Picture Award is almost the best Oscar for English film award. As of 2012, only nine non-English films were nominated for the Best Film Awards, including the 1938 Grand Mirage, the 1969 Focus News, and the 1972 Great Immigration. "Cry and Whisper", "Postman" in 1995, "Beautiful Life" in 1998, "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon" in 2000, "The Letter from Iwo Jima" in 2006, and "Love" in 2012. paragraphs.context: In the 100 years after the death of Octavian, history was called the silver age of Roman literature. During this period, Rome was continuously weakened in politics, and internal contradictions became increasingly fierce. The characteristics of its literary development were that the courts were becoming more and more interesting, advocating the fancy of the style and the abuse of rhetoric, making the style seem crowded and bloated. This feature reached its climax in the first half of the 2nd century. The aristocratic youths are fashionable by publicly reading poems that are empty and empty, and literature has become a pastime for a few people. The most accomplished literary style in the silver age is the satirical literature reflecting the subordinates of the slave master and the works reflecting the dissatisfaction of the old republican. Lukan was one of the best poets of the Silver Age, creating the best epic "Fasaria" after Aeneas. Matthias is the best inscription poet in this era. The main poem is 12 volumes of the Inscriptions on the Inscriptions, more than 1,500. Its style is short, subtle, subtle, witty and humorous. Juvenal is known for his satirical poems. He grew up in the ancient metaphor of today, the poetry style is severe and sharp, and even if his verse is not genius, anger poetry has become a famous saying. In the 19th century when the European bourgeois revolution was soaring, Givinal’s work received great attention, and Schiller, Hugo and Belinsky gave him high marks. In terms of lyric poems, Stetius is almost the only accomplished poet who is good at describing the tastes of the leisure class. Seneca is the most important tragedy writer in ancient Rome. He is influenced by Stoic philosophy, is good at rhetoric and philosophy, and has served as a teacher of the famous tyrant Nero. He advocates that people use their inner peace to overcome the pain in life and promote sympathy and love. He has written nine tragedies and one satirical drama in his life, mostly from the Greek tragedy. The style of his work is sublime and serious, and there are a lot of moral preaching, which makes his dialogue and characters lack realism. His masterpiece is the tragedy "Troy Women." Seneca was killed by Nero in his later years for participating in the Senate's nobility against Nero's tyranny.

paragraphs.context: In 1610, Galileo observed the four satellites for several days and found that although Jupiter was moving in the air, the satellite orbited Jupiter, and it was supported by Copernicus's argument that not all celestial bodies orbited the earth. Jupiter's Galilean satellite was named after Io Marius, Europa, Ganimide and Calisto shortly after the discovery in 1610. Before the 20th century, these names were not popular, replaced by the names of Io, Europa, or Jupiter's first satellite. These names were not widely used until the 20th century. Jupiter’s Galilean satellite belongs to Jupiter’s main satellite constellation or Galileo satellite in Jupiter’s satellite classification. Their radius is longer than any dwarf planet, and the diameter is the largest celestial body in the solar system except the sun and the eight planets. Io to Si are the 4th, 6th, 1st and 3rd largest natural satellites in the solar system. They account for 99.999% of the total mass of Jupiter's satellites. The mass of Jupiter is about 5,000 times that of the Galilean satellite. The Jupiter's Galilean satellite, in addition to the long distance of the moon, did not participate in the orbital resonance of Jupiter, and the other three satellites orbited Jupiter. These four large satellites all form a tide lock with Jupiter, that is, they all revolve to Jupiter in the same hemisphere. The distance between Io and Jupiter is 350,000 kilometers, and Jupiter is only 42.5 hours a week. Io's average orbital period has a 2:1 orbital resonance with Europa, and Ganimide has a 4:1 orbital resonance, that is, Eureo bypasses Jupiter for two weeks, and Europa bypasses for a week; Around the line, Gannimide walked around for a week. This resonance assists Io in maintaining orbital eccentricity and, in turn, provides the primary source of heat for Io's geological activities. The average distance between Europa and Jupiter is 670,900 kilometers, and it takes only three and a half days to revolve one week. Its orbit is very close to a perfect circle with an eccentricity of only 0.009. Like other Galilean satellites, Europa is also locked by the tides, so one hemisphere is always facing Jupiter. The orbit of Ganymede is 1.04 million kilometers from Jupiter. It is the third closest to Jupiter in the Galilean satellite. Its revolution period is 7 days and 3 hours. Like most known Jupiter satellites, Ganymede is also locked by Jupiter, always facing Jupiter on the same side.

paragraphs.context: During the period from 3500 BC to 1000 BC, it was called the period of ancient civilization. Ancient civilizations basically originated from rivers and river basins. Different periods are often occupied by different civilizations. They are roughly divided into regional environments: Mesopotamia: also known as the two river civilizations, originating from the Asian Tigris and Euphrates rivers. The two rivers civilization is also the oldest civilization with history. The civilization can be traced back to 5000 BC and formally formed no later than 3,500 BC. It was the Sumerians who lived in the two rivers and established the Sumerian civilization. Later, there were successively Akkadians, Hulitians, Kasits, Gurti, Amorites, Elams, Westerners, Assyrians, Chaldeans, Persians, and Macedonians. The greatest civilization after the Sumerians in the two rivers was the Babylon, founded by the Semitic Hammurabi. In the Mesopotamian region, in addition to the two river basins, there is the Karen River Basin, which gave birth to the Elan civilization. The origin of the Elan civilization has not yet been ascertained, and it was initially formed around 2700 BC. Nile civilization: originated in the Nile Valley in northeastern Africa, divided into ancient Egyptian civilization and Kush civilization. The history of ancient Egypt can be traced back to 4000 BC. Around 3150 BC, the king of Upper Egypt, Menis, unified and went to Egypt, and began the history of the Egyptian dynasty. It was divided into the early dynasty, the ancient kingdom, the first intermediate period, and the middle. Eight periods, including the kingdom, the second intermediate period, the new kingdom, the third intermediate period, and the post-dynasty. The Kush civilization was mainly formed in the Nubian region of the Nile River basin, which was initially formed around 2000 BC. Indus River Civilization: Originating from the Indus and Ganges Rivers in South Asia. The beginning of the Xalapa civilization dates back to 3300 BC and was formally formed before 2600 BC. The beginning of the Vedic civilization can be traced back to 1500 BC, and finally formed around 1000 BC.

paragraphs.context: The Academy Award, the full name of the Academy Awards, known as the Academy Awards, Gold Awards, Oscars or Oscars, is an annual event organized and presented by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences to encourage the creation and development of outstanding films over the past year. Since the 75th edition in 2002, the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood, Los Angeles has become a permanent venue for awards. This light armor will cause the warhead to detonate prematurely, causing the molten metal jet to accumulate outside the main armor in advance, thus becoming less effective. In the Second World War, there were many factory-made or crude armor used in this way to protect vehicles from new weapons such as Bazuka, Panzerfaust, and other high-explosive bombs. In response to the ever-improving high-explosive anti-tank warheads, the integrated gap-type armor was again used in the German leopard-type tank in the 1960s. The interior of this type of armor remains hollow, increasing the distance from the outside to the inside of the body at a given armor weight, thus reducing the penetration of the conical charge. Some armor even deliberately create several bevels on the inner surface of the hollow gap to dissipate the power of the pre-set path of the conical explosive jet. For example, for a given weight of armor, divided into two layers of 15 cm thick and a single layer of 30 cm thick, the former can have more protection against cone explosives. In the advanced tanks of the 1960s, almost all of them used gap armor as the main body, but they never became the actual mainstream armor system of the main battle tank. Today's light-duty vehicles are equipped with metal mesh, the so-called horizontal armor, and some main battle tanks also carry rubber side skirts to protect their relatively fragile suspension or front underside armor. The HP Shield uses the principle of gap armor to protect the space shuttle from high-speed micrometeoroids. The impact on the first layer will break up or destroy the incoming particles, causing the fragments to spread over a larger range in the subsequent compartment to disperse the energy of the impact.

paragraphs.context: British military historian Kosher Barnett claimed that the Treaty of Versailles was actually quite kind compared to the peace treaty that Germany expected to impose on the Allies after winning the war. In contrast to the Brest-Litovsk Treaty, Russia lost one-third of the population, half of the industry, 90% of the coal producing area and 6 billion marks of war compensation. Barnett also believes that Germany's strategic situation after signing the treaty is better than that of 1914. The Russian Empire and the Austro-Hungarian Empire, which previously played a role in balancing Germany in the East, disappeared, and there was Poland as a buffer between Germany and the new Russia. . In the West, there are only France and Belgium, both economically and inferior in population. Barnett also believes that Britain and France should achieve a permanent peace on the European continent through a way to completely destroy the unified Germany created by Bismarck and re-separate it into a number of weaker political entities. Only by doing so can Germany be completely solved. The trouble brought by Europe, but the United Kingdom did not achieve its goal of participating in the war. If we do not think about the issue from a modern strategic or economic perspective, the Treaty of Versailles planted the seeds of hatred in the hearts of the Germans and then took root under the nurturing of the Nazis. This is also the blatant trampling of the Treaty when Hitler came to power and The reason for winning a domestic cheer. The historian Dan Lorraine said that the chain reaction of the Treaty of Versailles triggered the Second World War. Historians have disputed the view that the Treaty of Versailles weakened and humiliated Germany. Some views are as follows: the Disarmament Commission in the Treaty of Versailles is in name only, the amount of war compensation in Germany is decreasing until it is almost cancelled, the financial burden and the cost of post-war reconstruction in the injured country. In fact, he was transferred from Germany to the victim country. Compared with the Allies, Germany’s economic and industrial potential is less affected by the war. Although Germany suffered losses during the war, the advantage of the German economy compared to its neighbors in 1919 was more pronounced than in 1913. Some critics who have a negative opinion of the Treaty of Versailles believe that the establishment of Poland has protected Germany from its biggest potential enemy, Russia. The Battle of Warsaw in 1920 blocked the pace of Bolshevism's march toward the post-war weak Europe, especially at this time Germany was facing the proliferation of communist trends. There were still Polish-speaking minority communities in Germany after the war, which exacerbated the ongoing ethnic conflict in the history of the German Empire. After the war, Germany maintained a greater influence on the Balkan countries than its southeastern neighbors, while other countries did not try to change this situation. In short, despite Germany's failure in the First World War, there is still the ability to dominate the European situation again in 20 years.

paragraphs.context: The main role of the International Monetary Fund is the auditor. The main designer of the specific provisions of the International Monetary Fund is the US Deputy Treasury Secretary Henry Dickert White. Although John Maynard Keynes, head of the British delegation, strongly opposed the use of the US dollar as the sole substitute for gold in the IMF treaty, the countries finally signed an agreement to establish an international monetary fund at the meeting on July 22. . The terms of the agreement were implemented on December 27, 1945, and the International Monetary Fund was formally established as part of the post-World War II reconstruction plan. It officially opened on March 1, 1947. Sometimes the International Monetary Fund, the Bank for International Settlements and the World Bank are known as the Bretton Woods institutions. Almost all countries with market economies have their financial policies affected by these three institutions. Applications for joining the International Monetary Fund will first be considered by the board of directors of the fund. After that, the Board of Directors will submit a report on the membership resolution to the Governance Committee, which will recommend how many quotas and terms the applicant country can allocate in the fund. After the Governance Committee accepts the application, the country needs to amend the law, confirm the signed entry documents, and commit to comply with the rules of the fund. paragraphs.context: On August 6, 1991, he posted an article on the World Wide Web project profile on the alt.hypertext newsgroup. This day also marks the debut of the public service of the World Wide Web on the Internet. The key concept in the World Wide Web, Hypertext, originated from several previous projects in the 1960s. For example, Ted Nielsen's Sinna Project and Douglas Ingebat's NLS. The inspiration for both projects is based on the Memex system designed by Vannival Busch for microfilm in his 1945 paper "Like Us." Another brilliant breakthrough of Tim Bernez-Lee is the grafting of hypertext to the Internet. In his book Weaving the Network, he explained that he repeatedly suggested to the members of the technical community that the combination of the two technologies was feasible, but no one accepted his suggestion. He finally had to solve this problem himself. plan. He invented three key technologies: a system that is uniquely authenticated by global network resources, and the Uniform Resource Identifier Hyper-File Markup Language Hypertext Transfer Protocol The World Wide Web and many other hypertext systems have many differences. Global Information Online requires a single connection rather than a two-way connection, which allows anyone to link the resource without any action by the resource owner. This is critical to reducing the difficulty of implementing web servers and web browsers compared to earlier network systems, but its side effect is the chronic problem of link failure. Unlike some application software such as HyperCard, World Wide Web is not proprietary, which allows servers and clients to independently develop and extend functionality without licensing restrictions. On April 30, 1993, CERN announced that the World Wide Web is free to anyone and does not charge any fees. Two months later, the Gopher agreement announced that it was no longer free to use, causing a large number of users to move from Gopher to the World Wide Web. The early popular web browsers were ViolaWWW for Unix and X Windows systems. Scholars generally believe that a turning point in the World Wide Web is the 1993 Mosaic web browser, a graphical interface browser developed by the National Supercomputer Application Center team at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, by Mark Anderson. Lead development. Mosaic's development funds come from the US high-speed computing and communications program and the high-speed computing and communications bill, which is one of several computing development plans initiated by US Senator Al Gore. Before the release of Mosaic, images were usually not mixed with the text on the web, and the popularity of the World Wide Web was much lower than the old protocols used on the Internet, such as Gopher and WAIS. Mosaic's graphical user interface makes World Wide Web the most popular Internet protocol.

paragraphs.context: The Central Committee of the Communist Party of China was originally scheduled to establish the People's Bank of China and issue RMB in January 1949. With the smooth progress of the Liberation War, the scattered liberated areas have quickly joined together. In order to adapt to the development of the situation, a unified currency is needed to replace the liberated area currencies of the original variety and inconvenient. In the second half of 1948, the preparatory office of the People's Bank of China reorganized the printing bank in the three major liberated areas of North China, Central China and Northwest China. On December 1, 1948, the People's Government of North China posted a notice to announce the establishment of the People's Bank of China. Nan Hanjun was appointed as the general manager of the People's Bank of China, and the deputy general manager was Hu Jingwei and Guan Xuewen. On the same day, the first batch of RMB was officially issued in the bank of Pingshan County, Hebei Province. Its number is 00000001; then, it is issued in Shijiazhuang with RMB 20 yuan and RMB 10 yuan. The first set of RMB has a gradual process from the initial launch to the circulation of the Chinese market. First, it stops using the Golden Coupon issued by the National Government. Secondly, it bans the circulation of gold, silver and foreign currency. At the same time, it gradually recovers the currency issued by each region and gradually recovers it according to the prescribed price. After the end of the Huaihai and Pingjin campaigns, the Battle of Dujiang was initiated. Four wild south passes through the Central Plains. The renminbi entered the national circulation market with the army and unified the national currency system. On March 10, 1949, the RMB was officially issued in the Central Plains Liberated Area. In February of the same year, a fleet of 30 or 40 large trucks was loaded with RMB for the use of the South Army to occupy Nanjing and Shanghai. On the second day after the escort of the renminbi arrived in Shanghai, they took over the Central Mint and the Central Printing Factory of the National Government. On the third day, they began to use the equipment and personnel there to print the renminbi. In December 1949, the former South of the South China Liberated Area The People's Bank of China was changed to the People's Bank of China South China Branch, and its branches were merged into the People's Bank of China system. The South African currency and other currencies of the South China Liberation Army Region were acquired at a fixed price. On July 23, 1950, the Hainan Military and Political Committee issued a notice announcing that the circulation of the votes issued by the Qiongya Revolutionary Base was stopped. The circulation area of the RMB has expanded to Hainan. In April 1951, the Northeast Bank and the Inner Mongolia People's Bank unified the People's Bank of China system, and the RMB became the currency of the Northeast and Inner Mongolia. At the end of 1951, the RMB became the currency of the Xinjiang region; from July 15, 1957, the RMB replaced the Tibetan currency. Become the home currency of Tibet.

paragraphs.context: Konstantin Tsiolkovsky first realized that multi-stage rockets are indispensable regardless of the chemical fuel used. It is able to gain freedom in the Earth's gravitational field, and the escape velocity into the interplanetary space is about 11,000 km / h. The energy required to enter the low Earth orbit is 32 MJ / kg. The energy required to climb to the same height is 10 kJ. 20 times /km·kg. Sub-orbital flight and orbital flight have major differences. The lowest orbit around the Earth is 350 km above sea level. The common misconception is that the orbit is only at this height to reach the boundary of space. In theory, the required orbital velocity can be obtained at any height, but the atmospheric drag eliminates the orbits that are too low in height. As long as there is enough speed, the aircraft can also enter the orbit, but at present, this speed is several times faster than the current technology can achieve. Another common misconception is that people on the track are outside the gravitational pull of the Earth because they are floating. They float because they are free-falling: they are accelerating to the Earth along with space vehicles, but at the same time they are moving away from the straight path at a fast enough speed to keep them at a constant distance on the surface of the Earth. The gravitational pull of the Earth far exceeds the Van Allen Belt and keeps the Moon in an orbit of 384,403 kilometers above the Earth. Space is not a perfect vacuum: different regions are defined by different atmospheres and winds, and they dominate those regions, and the wind expands beyond the originally defined region. Earth's space extends from the Earth's atmosphere to the Earth's magnetosphere, making it distinct from the interplanetary space of the solar wind. The interplanetary space extends to the solar circle, which is where the solar wind and the interstellar medium meet. Interstellar space continues to extend to the edge of the Milky Way and then gradually disappears into the voids between the galaxies.

paragraphs.context: Earth space is an outer space area adjacent to the Earth. Geospatial areas include areas above the atmosphere, such as the ionosphere and magnetosphere, and the Van Allen radiation belt is also in the Earth's space. The area between the Earth's atmosphere and the moon is sometimes referred to as the Earth's Moon space. Although it satisfies the definition of outer space, the atmospheric density within a few hundred kilometers above the Carmen line can still cause sufficient resistance to the satellite. Many satellites operate in this area known as low-Earth orbit, and every few days they need to start their engines to maintain orbit. Although the resistance here is very low, it is theoretically enough to surpass the radiation pressure of the solar sail, which is a propulsion system recommended by interplanetary travel. The density of charged particles stuffed in Earth's space is very low, and their motion is controlled by the Earth's magnetic field. These materials formed by the plasma are disturbed by the solar storm, and the current flowing to the upper atmosphere of the Earth is driven by the solar wind. When magnetic storms occur in two regions of the Earth's space, the radiating zone and the ionosphere cause strong disturbances. The increased flow of high-energy electrons caused by these storms can cause permanent damage to the circuits on the satellite. Disturbing telecommunications and GPS technology, and even astronauts in low Earth orbit will be harmed. They also create aurora near the Earth's magnetic poles. Earth's space also contains many of the remains of previously launched manned or unmanned space vehicles, potentially damaging the subsequent space vehicles. Some debris will return to Earth's atmosphere after a period of time. The lack of air in the Earth's space is an ideal place for astronomers to observe all the electromagnetic spectrum. The wonderful pictures sent back by the Hubble Space Telescope are visible, allowing light from 13.7 billion years ago - almost the period of the big bang - to be observed. The upper boundary of the Earth's space is the interface between the magnetosphere and the solar wind, and the inner boundary is the ionosphere. In other words, the Earth's space is the outer space between the upper layer of the Earth's atmosphere and the outermost side of the Earth's magnetic field.

e. The area between the Earth's atmosphere and the moon

paragraphs.context: Scottish engineer John Rogi Baird began working with the BBC in 1932 to try TV broadcasts. On November 2, 1936, the BBC began the world's first television broadcast service. In August 1998, the BBC's domestic channel began to use satellite broadcasts; an unexpected result of this was that as long as European viewers used British-made satellite decoders, they could also watch BBC1 and BBC2. On November 11, 2012, the former chief executive of the BBC, George Entwist, was reported to have resigned when he was reported to have reported a sexual assault on children, misrepresenting a scandal involving a senior Conservative Party member. By Tony Hull, he was appointed as the chief executive officer and became the shortest-serving president when he took office on September 17, 2012. The BBC's Royal Charter expired in 2006. paragraphs.context: Geometric optics, also known as ray optics, describes the propagation of light. In geometric optics, light is called a ray. Light changes the direction of propagation at the interface of two different media, and it is possible to bend the curve in a medium whose refractive index changes with position. The light in geometric optics is an abstract object whose direction of travel is perpendicular to the wavefront of the light wave. Geometric optics gives the law of the propagation of light through an optical system to predict the position of its actual wavefront. The Fermat principle is the basic theorem of geometric optics: the path of light propagation is the path through which light passes in the shortest time, from which many laws of geometric optics can be derived. Consider an optical system composed of a lens, a mirror and a cymbal. Geometric optics can be used to illustrate the reflection, refraction, etc. It should be noted that geometric optics simplifies the optical theory, so it cannot explain many important optics. Effects such as diffraction, polarization, etc. Geometrical optics can be further simplified by paraxial approximation and correspond to linearization in mathematical descriptions. Under paraxial approximation conditions, optical components and systems can be represented by a simple matrix. Both Gaussian optics and paraxial ray tracing are developed on the basis of a paraxial approximation to determine the first-order properties of the optical system, such as finding the imaging position, the position of the object, and the approximation of the magnification. Gaussian beam propagation is an extension of paraxial optics that more accurately describes coherent propagation. Even if a paraxial approximation is still used, this technique can partially describe the diffraction, and can accurately calculate the rate at which the laser beam travels with distance and its minimum convergence size. Gaussian beam propagation theory can therefore communicate geometric optics and physical optics.

paragraphs.context: Manchuria usually refers to the entire three provinces of Liaoning, Jilin and Heilongjiang today, sometimes adding the entire northeastern part of Inner Mongolia and the old Rehe province. In the broad sense, Manchuria will also include the Manchuria, which is the area south of the Wai Xing'an Mountains. The area of Manchuria in the traditional sense is about 830,000 square miles, which is larger than the combined total of Western European countries such as France, Britain and Ireland, Germany, Italy and Spain. Although the name of Manchuria is named after the Manchurian family, it is only explained as a tribal name in Manchu, and there is no meaning of place names. Manchuria was first used as a place name in the book "Japanese Border Sea Sketch" by Japanese scholar Takahashi Kenzo. It was not until the end of the 19th century that Western powers, especially the Russian imperialist powers extended to this point, and the significance of Manchuria as a place name began to stand out. Since then, Russia and Japan have become familiar with the world. However, the Qing government still uses the three provinces to call this area in formal occasions. For example, in 1902, the Sino-Russian Treaty on the Settlement of the Three Eastern Provinces and the Treaty on the Third East Province of the China-Japan Conference in 1905 were all referred to in the three eastern provinces. After the Second World War, newspapers in the CCP-controlled area, such as the "Dongbei Daily", used the vocabulary of the North Manchurian, the South Manchu, and the East Manchu in the Manchuria period to be used in the northeast, northeast, and northeast. east. The CCP and the military region set up the East, South, West, and North Bureaus and the East, South, West, and North Manchu Districts. To modern times, the people of Liao, Kyrgyzstan and Black are still used. For example, the older generation used to call the northern part of Manchuria as Beiman. Nowadays, in China, the three provinces of Liaoning, Jilin and Heilongjiang in the Manchuria region are generally used in the northeast, northeastern three provinces, the three eastern provinces or the Kanto region, but sometimes the northeast also includes the northeastern part of Inner Mongolia. At present, the Manchus in the northeastern region do not account for the majority of the population, and Manchuria has rarely been used as a place name, especially the official; because the last emperor of the Qing Dynasty, Pu Yi, established the Manchurian state controlled by the Japanese army, and was widely regarded by the Chinese as the Japanese empire that invaded China. The embarrassment, the word Manchuria will make some people first think of the word pseudo-full, not Manchu or Manchuria. Chinese officials still use the term Manchuria in terms of historical terminology, such as cultural relics such as the former site of the Manchurian Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China, exclusive names such as Manzhouli City, and some enterprises such as Beiman Special Steel. In countries such as South Korea, North Korea, Japan, and Russia, which are close to Manchuria and other countries in the world, Manchuria is still very common as a geographical name.

paragraphs.context: Baroque art is an artistic style in Europe in the 17th century. It uses exaggerated movement and clear and discernible details to create drama, tension, cumbersomeness and grandeur in the fields of sculpture, painting, architecture, literature, dance and music. This style originated in Rome in Italy around 1600 and was later spread to most parts of Europe. The popularity and success of the Baroque style is related to the encouragement of the Roman Catholic Church. In response to the rise of religious reforms at the time, the church decided at the Trento meeting that art should express religious themes directly and emotionally. The aristocrats at the time considered the dramatic Baroque architecture and art to be a means of dumping their guests and expressing victory, power and control. The Baroque palace with its vestibule, grand staircase and luxurious reception room was built. There are many different sources of the word Baroque. One comes from Portuguese or Spanish, meaning irregular beads. As an adjective, this word has a vulgar meaning. The Europeans originally used this term to refer to works that lacked the balance of classicism; another said that it came from Italian, with strange, quirky or inferentially wrong meanings. But in fact the original source is not certain. In general, it was originally a person who admired classical art in the 18th century. It is a derogatory term different from the Renaissance style in the 17th century. Today the word has lost its original derogatory meaning, referring only to a kind of 17th century popular in Europe. Art style. Although Baroque refers to art works that lack classical balance, in fact, Baroque artists, like the predecessors of the Renaissance, attach great importance to the overall unity of design and effect. The Baroque style is characterized by emphasis on movement and transformation, especially body and mood. On the one hand, at the same time, Baroque is also a reaction to the doctrine. In the history of European culture, Baroque used to refer to the 17th century and the first half of the 18th century, but the vintage does not represent absolute artistic style, especially architecture and music. paragraphs.context: The Pearl Harbor incident, also known as the raid on Pearl Harbor, Japan’s Pearl Bay attack or Hawaiian war, AI warfare, and Z warfare was a raid on the US Navy’s Hawaiian Territory’s Pearl Harbor Naval Base on December 7, 1941. Combat. The plan to attack Pearl Harbor comes from diplomatic conflicts between Japan and the United States. Since Japan launched its war against China in 1937, it has been unable to escape for a long time, and the economy has gone from bad to worse. In order to continue its war against China, Japan’s national policy has gradually moved toward a plan to seize resources from other countries. In 1938, the then Japanese Prime Minister, Weibo, proposed the Great East Asia The idea of the circle seriously threatened the interests of the United States in China and Asia and triggered a strong protest from the United States. In 1941, the US government asked Japan to withdraw its troops from the French Indochina, and to stop all oil exports to Japan along with the Netherlands and the United Kingdom. Since oil is an essential element for the Japanese military to continue the war, the United States has finally decided that Japan will finally adopt a policy of advancing the South China policy to capture the rich reserves of the United Kingdom and the Netherlands. At the same time, because the commander of the Japanese joint fleet, Yamamoto, believes that the United States is bound to interfere, it must be given to the US Navy. The fatal blow of the Pacific Fleet has enabled Japan to negotiate with the United States under favorable conditions after the South has achieved results and consolidated its power. To this end, Yamamoto plans to attack Pearl Harbor. The Japanese Navy sent six aircraft carriers, a total of more than 300 fighters, divided into two waves of attacks. Due to the surprise attack on the US military, the Japanese army achieved great results: sinking and damaging eight US warships, three cruisers, and three destroyers, destroying 188 fighters, causing 2,402 deaths and 1,282 injuries. However, the victory of the Japanese army is not complete: the island's power station, maintenance equipment, fuel and command headquarters building have not been destroyed, and the real main force of the future naval battle - the aircraft carrier is not in the port. Even so, compared with the loss of the United States, Japan’s losses were minimal: only 29 aircraft and 5 pocket submarines were lost. A total of 65 soldiers were killed or missing, and a Japanese submarine crew was captured. This military attack has had a major impact on the development of the Second World War. Due to Japan’s undeclared action, American public opinion was furious, and the country’s self-isolationism turned to support the war; while Europe’s Germany and Italy also declared war on the United States, and the United States joined the European battlefield. The strong industrial capabilities of the United States gave a large amount of resources to the various anti-axis countries, leading to the demise of the final Axis. In addition, due to the attitude of President Franklin Roosevelt's allies and the desire to join the World War before the war, there was a conspiracy theory that knew that the Japanese army was about to attack Pearl Harbor without warning. It is still controversial. After the Pearl Harbor incident, Roosevelt published the famous "National Shame Speech", claiming that December 7 was a day in which the United States lived in shame and later became the country's anniversary.

paragraphs.context: As a political system, the difference between dictatorship and democracy is mainly due to the control of judicial power and legislative power in the dictatorship.
