paragraphs.context: Paul Adrian Morris Dirac, OM, FRS is a British theoretical physicist and one of the founders of quantum mechanics. He once chaired the Lucas Mathematical Professorship at Cambridge University and spent the last fourteen years of his life at Florida State University. Dirac has many groundbreaking contributions to physics. He integrated the matrix mechanics of Werner Heisenberg and the wave dynamics of Erwin Schrödinger and developed the basic mathematical structure of quantum mechanics. The Dirac equation he gave can describe the physical behavior of fermions, explain the spin of the particles, and first predict the existence of antiparticles. He also played a leading role in path integration and secondary quantization, which laid an important foundation for the development of quantum electrodynamics. In addition, he introduced the concept of topology into physics and proposed the theory of magnetic unipolar. In 1933, because "found a new form that was useful in atomic theory," Dirac and Schrödinger jointly won the Nobel Prize in Physics, the youngest award-winning theoretical physicist in history.

paragraphs.context: It is often the case that alien species need to survive a period of low population density to become invasive species in new locations. When the population is small, alien species are difficult to breed and survive, so a species may need to reach a location many times before it can survive. The cyclical round-trip activities of humans, such as the transportation of ships between ports and the highways of cars, give these species more opportunities. When alien species can compete for indigenous species in competition for nutrients, sunlight, space, water or food, it can become an invasive species. If these species evolved under intense competition or great predation pressure, and there are no competitors in the new environment, these invaders can grow very quickly. For an ecosystem where all resources are fully utilized, each point of invasive species gains is a loss of indigenous species. However, the ultimate extinction of indigenous species caused by this unilateral competitive advantage is not achieved overnight. They can coexist for a considerable period of time. Gradually, when the population of invasive species increases significantly, and gradually adapt to the environment, the competitive advantage also changes. It’s obvious. Invasive species often make use of resources that are not available to indigenous species, such as deep water resources that can be harnessed by strong roots, and can survive in previously unsoiled soil types. A. serrata was introduced to California with low water retention, lack of nutrients, high magnesium and calcium, and soils with heavy metal toxicity. The general plant density in this soil is very low, but the aegilops can grow here and crowd out the indigenous species in these lands.

paragraphs.context: The exclusive economic zone, also known as the economic sea area, refers to a regional concept proposed by the International Law of the Sea to resolve disputes between countries due to sea areas. The exclusive economic zone refers to an area outside the territorial sea and adjacent to the territorial sea. The exclusive economic zone should not exceed 200 nautical miles from the baseline of the width of the territorial sea, except for points closer to another country. The countries to which the exclusive economic zone belongs have the right to explore, develop, use, maintain and manage the seabed and subsoil and the natural resources of the overlying waters, and the right to construct, use, research and protect the artificial facilities. Other countries still enjoy the freedom of navigation and overflight, as well as other international law-related uses related to these freedoms. The country has exclusive rights to exploit or permit the use of fishery resources and mineral resources in its exclusive economic zone. Economic sea areas are not territorial, but they are an extension of national sovereignty. The United Nations Third Conference on the Law of the Sea in 1982 made a resolution on the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, with detailed provisions for the exclusive economic zone. The Convention has been ratified by 160 countries, and currently only the United States, North Korea, Iran, Thailand, Libya, etc. have not yet ratified. Generally speaking, large powers or island countries, and still retaining many former colonial powers belonging to the island, are easy to obtain a large space for the declaration of exclusive economic zones. For example, the United States has territories such as Hawaii, Alaska, Guam, and Saipan on both sides of the two oceans and on the Pacific Ocean and the Atlantic Ocean, making it the world's largest exclusive economic zone. The United Kingdom and France have used their islands in the Pacific, Atlantic and Indian Oceans to declare a vast exclusive economic zone, the eighth and second in the world. Australia is a sea-going island surrounded by the sea. In addition to the connection with Papua New Guinea and New Zealand, it can also declare a huge economic zone.

qas.question: What is the exclusive economic zone?

answers.text: a regional concept proposed by the International Law of the Sea to resolve disputes between countries
a regional concept proposed by the International Law of the Sea to resolve disputes between countries

paragraphs.context: The design of the station hall of Shanghai Station adopts the scheme of “North-South opening, high-input and low-out, and over-line waiting” proposed by East China Architectural Design Institute. Entering the station can enter through two entrances to the north and south, and at the same time, the soft entrance waiting entrance is set up in the east of the entrance, and the soft waiting room is directly connected. The passengers who get off the bus can quickly exit through the underground passage through a total of three exits in the southeast, southwest and north exits. In addition, 80% of the waiting rooms are located above the platform. Passengers enter through the north-south entrance and are transported by escalator to the second-floor central corridor. There are 5 waiting rooms on the left and right sides of the central corridor. Passengers enter the relevant waiting hall according to the outdoor electronic display instructions of each waiting car. The outside of the left and right side of the waiting hall is connected to each platform through the left and right elevated passages to shorten the passenger's boarding time. The structure has been adopted by many large stations in mainland China. The ground floor hall is mainly composed of a group waiting room, a soft waiting room and a pit stop. In 2003, after the opening of Hong Kong and Macao Free Trade, in order to speed up the running time of the Shanghai-Hong Kong Express train, Shanghai Customs set up entry and exit ports on the ground floor of the station hall and entered the joint inspection hall through special channels. In addition, in order to avoid the hedge between the ticket purchasers and the crowds entering and leaving the station, Shanghai stood at the southeast side of the main station hall, that is, the junction of Meiyuan Road at Fuling Road, and a joint ticketing hall was built. There are more than 40 windows in the whole hall. After the opening of the Yangtze River Delta EMU, the Shanghai Station added an automatic ticketing hall to the east side of the southeast exit to reduce the pressure on ticket purchases in the joint ticketing hall.

answers.text: in order to avoid the hedge between the ticket purchasers and the crowds entering and leaving the station
reduce the pressure on ticket purchases in the joint ticketing hall

paragraphs.context: The Republic of Niger is one of the landlocked countries in West Africa. It is named after the Niger River and the capital of Niamey. It is bordered by Chad in the east, Nigeria and Benin in the south, Burkina Faso and Marley in the west, Algeria in the north, and Libya in the northeast. The total length of the border is 5,500 kilometers. With an area of 1,267,600 square kilometers, it is the world's lowest development country. From the 8th to the 16th centuries, there were three powerful countries in the upper and middle reaches of the Niger River: the Ghanaian Empire, the Marley Empire, and the Sanghai Empire. The Bornu Empire was raised in the Lake Chad area from the 11th to the 18th centuries. Although the kingdom of Ghana and the ruling center of the Marley Empire were not in Niger, they had a great influence on the region through trade. The western and central parts of Niger were once part of the Sanghai Empire. In 1897, it was occupied by France in 1900 and became a French colony in 1904, which was incorporated into French West Africa. On August 3, 1960, Hamani Diori became the first president. In April 1974, the Chief of Staff of the Armed Forces, Saini Conte, launched a coup to seize power. Conche was in power until his death in November 1987, and was succeeded by Ali Saebu. In March 1993, Mahaman Ottoman won the country’s first democratic presidential election, but his government was overthrown by a military coup in January 1996. Tandja Mamadou was elected president in November 1999 and was re-elected in December 2004. He was overthrown by the military on February 18, 2010.

paragraphs.context: Taitung City is located in the southeastern part of Taiwan. It is the county seat of Taitung County. It is 121.10 degrees east longitude and 22.45 degrees north latitude. It is adjacent to Beinan Township in the west of the Central Mountain Range and the southwest neighboring Zhiben River and Taima Lixiang. The mountains are bounded by the Black Creek and Beinan Townships, and the east is the Pacific Ocean. It is a city with a narrow mountain surface. With an area of 109.7691 square kilometers, it is the largest county-administered city in Taiwan. It is 19.8 kilometers long from north to south. The main streams are from north to south - Beinan River, Taiping River, Lijiaxi and Zhibenxi, which flow into the Pacific Ocean in turn, forming an alluvial fan plain. The terrain of Taitung City. Nearly half of the county's population is based in the city. The highest point in Taitung City is the carp mountain with an elevation of 75 meters, overlooking the city of Taitung. During the period of the Hezhi and the early Qing Dynasty, it was called "Beinan" together with other places in Houshan. Han people had traded. paragraphs.context: The birthplace of Taitung City Street, "Bao Sang", was originally the name of one of the Ami people. During the Guangxu period, the Beinan Hall was established. Later, Taiwan’s governor Liu Mingchuan promoted the restructuring. The name was Taitung Zhili. Before the Japanese leader, it was renamed "Nanxiang New Street". After the Japanese leader, it was called "Beinan Street". On January 15, 1919, it was renamed "Taidong Street" and belonged to Taitung Hall. On December 1, 1944, Beinanzhuang was merged into Taitung Street, which was adjusted by the Governor's Office in the last administrative district of Taiwan. In 1945, after receiving the jurisdiction of the Governor's Office of Japan, the Government of the Republic of China changed its name to "Taidong Town" and was under the jurisdiction of the Taitung County Government. The area under the original Beinan Zhuang was separated again, and Liji, Fuyuan, Fushan and other places on the north side of Taitung Street were separated and Beinan Township was set up. On October 10, 1974, the Fugan, Yanwan, Nanwang, Xinyuan, Jianxing, Nanrong, Beinan, Zhiben, Toyota, and Jianhe villages of Beinan Township were merged into the territory. The threshold of the city's 100,000 population. In 1976, the New Year's Day was upgraded to "Taiwan City."

paragraphs.context: The Vice-Chairman of the People's Republic of China is one of the two major positions within the "President of the People's Republic of China", one of the central institutions of the People's Republic of China. It has a high honorary character. As for the possession of real power and otherwise, it depends on the holder within the Chinese Communist Party. Status and position. According to the current Constitution of the People's Republic of China, the vice-chairman assists the chairman; under the authority of the chairman, he may exercise part of the chairman's power; when the chairman is absent, the vice-chairman assumes the post of chairman; when the vice-chair is absent , by the National People's Congress for by-election. The "Deputy of the People's Republic of China" was established since the first National People's Congress in 1954; the Constitution passed during the Cultural Revolution in 1975 decided to cancel the "President of the People's Republic of China" and "Vice-Chairman"; The "82 Constitution" was resumed. According to the current Constitution, the vice-chairman of the People’s Republic of China is elected by the National People’s Congress in accordance with the Constitution for a term of five years and may be renewed for a maximum of two terms. The Constitution also stipulates that, like the President of the State, the candidate for the Vice-President must be a citizen of the People’s Republic of China who is 45 years of age and has the right to vote and be elected. According to the Constitution enacted in 1982, the presidency of the People's Republic of China is a symbolic vacant head of state, with the highest status and the highest representation of the state, but does not independently determine any state affairs. Despite the lofty status of the Vice-President, the symbolic significance is far greater than the essence. Because there is no real power, in history, non-Chinese Communist Party members have served as vice-presidents of the People’s Republic of China, such as Soong Ching Ling and Rong Yiren, and the Vice-Chairman of the State has become the highest-ranking post of non-CCP members.

answers.text: s absent , by the National People's Congress

paragraphs.context: No written records have been found in the Neolithic Age, so all statements about any belief system that the Neolithic society may have are speculated from archaeology. French archaeologist Jacques Cowen said that the Neolithic revolution was influenced by an important theme he called the "symbolic revolution," which showed the birth of "religion" in the Neolithic Age. He believes that humans in the Neolithic Age were affected by changes in thought, more than the impact of environmental change, and pointed out a series of stages of this process. His research proposes an important concept of the evolution of human thinking such as perception and duality by examining the earliest females as goddesses and bulls as gods' pottery and early art. The Central European Neolithic ring structure during the 5th millennium BC was interpreted as an educational function. Part of the Goosek Circle, the remains of human sacrifice were discovered. Many of these structures have openings aligned with the sunset or sunrise orientation to the point, indicating that they are a way to maintain the lunar calendar. The construction of the megalithic culture in Europe began in the 5th millennium BC and continued throughout the Neolithic Age, and some areas have already entered the early Bronze Age. Maria Gimbutas, the pioneer of feminist archaeology, proposed the concept of the "feminine center" society around the "Goddess Worship" in Europe in the Neolithic Age. Later, with the advent of the Bronze Age, the "matrix" culture of the Neolithic Age was replaced by patriarchy. However, Kimbutas’s views are not widely supported today.

qas.question: Who is the concept of "symbolic revolution"?
How many years was the Neolithic Age in Central Europe?
In which era did the "Goddess Worship" in Europe emerge?

paragraphs.context: Qianjiang City is a county-level city directly under the central government of Hubei Province. It is located in the hinterland of Jianghan Plain, with Hanshui in the north, Yueyang to Changsha in the south, Huangtong in Wuhan in the east and Jingzhou Dasanxia in the west. The 318 National Highway and the Shanghai-Chengdu Expressway and the Hu-Hai High-speed Railway traverse the east and west, and the Suiyue Expressway, Zaoshi Expressway and the sub-supervisor, the Miaoyue two-level highway and the Jianghan Plain freight railway run through the north and south. There are Hanjiang Zekou, Hongqi and Xinglong Wharf in the north, and the first artificial canal in China to connect the Yangtze River and the Han River in the west. The Xinglong Water Conservancy Project of the First Dam of the Chinese Plain is located in the Gaoshibei Town of Qianjiang. There are Jianghan Oilfield, one of the top ten oil fields in the country, and a farm group consisting of 16 state-owned farms. In 1994, it was listed as a provincial direct city. The terrain is flat and the ground elevation is between 26 and 31 meters. The whole territory is plain. It is a subtropical monsoon humid climate with abundant rainfall and pleasant climate. It is known as the “water garden”. Qianjiang is a member of the Wuhan City Circle. It is rich in grain and cotton on the ground and is rich in oil and gas underground. China Petroleum & Chemical Corporation - Jianghan Oilfield Branch Headquarters is located in Guanghua, Qianjiang City, Hubei Province. Qianjiang is a famous "water garden", the hometown of Metasequoia, the Jianghan Plain ecological civilization transportation demonstration city, and the famous writer Biye Zeng Sheng praised Qianjiang as "a green city." Qianjiang is the world's largest taurine production base, Asia's largest oil bit production base, and the country's largest ophthalmic drug production base. It has been awarded the "Chinese Crawfish Township" and "China Crayfish Food Township" "Chinese Folk Culture". The title of "Home of Art" and "The Capital of Chinese Drama".

paragraphs.context: The Federal Chancellor is the head of the government of the Federal Republic of Germany. The Prime Minister was elected by the German Federal Parliament without debate on the advice of the Federal President. After the appointment of the Federal President, he could officially become the Prime Minister, and the Federal President could not refuse to appoint the Prime Minister. The prime minister is usually the largest party in the parliament, the leader of the ruling party, and the deputy prime minister is the deputy. In the era of the Holy Roman Empire, the institution in charge of the Prime Minister was one of the important institutions. In Prussia and Austria, after the end of the 19th century empire, the position of the Prime Minister was reintroduced. Bismarck served as the Federal Chancellor during the Northern German Confederation. After the establishment of the German Empire in 1871, he served as the "imperial prime minister" or translated into the prime minister. In the Nazi Germany era, Hitler once again used the title of "Imperial Prime Minister". Later, Hitler became the prime minister of the Empire as the head of state and became the supreme ruler of Nazi Germany. After the Second World War, the Federal Republic of Germany was established. Its head of government is referred to as the "Federal Prime Minister", but not only the head of the German federal government is called the "federal prime minister", but the head of the Austrian government is also called the Federal Chancellor. On the other hand, the German Democratic Republic, also established in World War II, also established the post of Prime Minister, known as the “President of the Council of Ministers”, but the power and status of this position is under the General Secretary of the German Socialist Party.

paragraphs.context: The separation of powers is a kind of state ruling model. Its design disperses the public powers of various countries and does not concentrate them in a single organ, so that these separate organs can play a check and balance role. This term was first proposed by the British philosopher John Locke in the Age of Enlightenment in his "Government Theory", and such a design is usually known by the separation of the three powers proposed by the French philosopher Montesquieu. The three powers immediately legislate, administrative, and judicial powers are respectively exercised by three different functions of state organs, mutual restraint and balance of doctrines and systems. The form of political organization in which the three major government agencies coexist and check each other is a political system adopted by most countries in the world. An important political principle and political system of capitalist countries. The form of political organization opposite to it is the system of parliamentary cooperation. The idea of decentralization can be traced back to Aristotle in ancient Greece. He proposed that the state has the power of deliberation, administration, and judiciary, and that the chaos of the country is transferred by whether the three powers are reconciled. In the modern era, the theory of decentralization was clearly written in the 17th century British Locke. The most important political papers were two "Government Theories" written from 1689 to 1690. In 1748, France's Montesquieu was in the book "The Spirit of the Law". Develop the theory of Locke and systematically propose the principle of separation of powers. The forms of separation of power include administration, justice, and legislation to solve some of the problems that may arise in the political system. It proposes a plan for replacing the feudal monarchy with a political system after the bourgeois revolution. This doctrine is widely regarded as a powerful guarantee for a democratic system. After the capitalist countries generally implement the separation of powers, the general legislative power is exercised by the parliament, the executive power is exercised by the president or the cabinet, and the judicial power is exercised by the court.

paragraphs.context: The United Kingdom and most of the Great Britain Association countries use the Westminster parliamentary system, which has a greater connection between executive power and legislative power, but the judicial power is basically independent. Compared with the separation of the three powers originated in the United States, judicial independence can be described as the origin of the United Kingdom. The British Prime Minister and the Cabinet usually come from the House of Commons and are responsible to the House of Commons. If the Prime Minister and the Cabinet lose their support or trust in the House of Commons, they may either resign or ask the monarch to dissolve the House of Commons to re-elect. In the past, the British House of Lords had a judicial function, and the members who were responsible for hearing the nobility were called permanent appeal judges. After the Second World War, the judicial function of the House of Lords was basically exercised by the "Upper House Appeals Appeals Committee." This arrangement allows the House of Lords to combine legislative and judicial functions. Since the entry into force of the Constitutional Reform Act of 2005, the House of Lords has no longer retained judicial functions. The Privy Council of the United Kingdom also has certain judicial functions. After 2005, it only has jurisdiction over cases in overseas territories. The British parliamentary system also has considerable influence in countries around the world. For example, after Japan resumed sovereignty in 1952, the issue of "the bill originated from foreign countries" was controversial. However, in 1945 and 1946, there were many public discussions on constitutional reform. The Japanese Constitution, which was drafted by the Commander-in-Chief of the Allied Forces of Japan, Douglas MacArthur, was obviously influenced by Japanese liberalism, and the Japanese liberals regarded it. It is the most viable option to replace the Meiji Constitution of European-style authoritarianism.

paragraphs.context: The Republic of China adopts the five-right constitutional design proposed by Sun Yat-sen, the founding father of the country, in addition to the three powers of administration, legislation, and judiciary, plus the two powers of examination and supervision. The idea of separation of powers is that Sun Yat-sen combines the separation of the three powers with the West and the ancient Chinese political system, and proposes a political system with Chinese characteristics. According to the original constitution, the president is a virtual head of state. The National Assembly is a political institution. In addition to the power to amend the constitution, it also exercises four powers of election, recall, creation, and reconsideration. The National Assembly is responsible for electing the president. The following is the administrative court and the Legislative Yuan. The five courts of the court, the examination court, and the supervisory authority exercise the five powers of administration, legislation, justice, examination, and supervision. In practice, the government of the Republic of China after the constitutional amendment strengthened the power of the executive. The president can directly appoint the president of the Executive Yuan without the consent of the Legislative Yuan. The 2005 amendment to the Constitution freezes the provisions related to the National Assembly, making the Legislative Yuan the sole legislature. After the examination court and the supervisory court changed their power to exercise the consent of the Legislative Yuan, the powers have been greatly weakened, the courts have been transferred to the judicial administrative organs, and the general cases have been handled by the courts at all levels. The powers of the court judges who have set their terms of office have exercised their constitutional review powers. .

paragraphs.context: The American Society of Industrial Engineers defined industrial engineering in 1955: Industrial Engineering is a combination of expertise in applied mathematics, applied physics, and social sciences, as well as principles and methods of engineering analysis and design for people, materials, information, equipment, and The integrated system of energy is designed, improved and implemented, and the results of the system are identified, predicted and evaluated. In lean manufacturing systems, industrial engineers are committed to eliminating waste of time, money, materials, energy, and other resources in the production process. They make the product quality stable and easier to manufacture, and finally increase production. Unlike most specialized fields of application in engineering disciplines, industrial engineering is widely used in almost every industry. For example, how to shorten the long queues in front of the theme park, optimize the operation method, global cargo delivery, and manufacture more affordable and reliable vehicles. The name industrial engineering is easy to misunderstand. At first, industrial engineering was called scientific management, and now, industrial engineering in Korea and other countries is called industrial engineering, which is more in line with its current application. It was originally used in manufacturing, but now it is widely used in other related services and industries. Industrial engineering is also often referred to as operational management, systems engineering and engineering management. In order to reduce the engineering and design costs of a project, the population is often broken down into components that can be designed and manufactured at one time and that can be applied to many similar products. For example, a typical tape player has a tape deck manufactured using precision injection casting, which is manufactured and inspected by a small factory and supplied to a much larger company as a component. The tool design cost of this deck is averaged by a large number of different models, and other products only need to design a suitable mounting position.

paragraphs.context: The deformed dragon means "a weird lizard" and is a giant herbivorous dinosaur. The deformed dragon was one of the earliest dinosaurs found in the sauropod. The deformed dragon is about 24 meters long. They lived in the Early Cretaceous, from 138 million years ago to 112 million years ago. Their fossils were found in England and Portugal. Fossils contain a humerus, spine, a sacrum, pelvis, limb fragments, and skin marks; they cover hexagonal scales. The deformed dragon was the first sauropod to be identified as a dinosaur, but it was not the earliest discovered sauropod dinosaur. In 1841, Richard Owen discovered whales, but classified them as large marine life, similar to crocodiles. It was not until Gideon Mantel identified the deformed dragon as a dinosaur that the whale dragon was also a dinosaur. The complex classification history of the deformed dragon and the whale dragon. The model of the whale dragon is a short-body whale, which was founded by Richard Owen in 1842 based on several fossils discovered in the Early Cretaceous. Several fossils were later found to belong to the poultry dragon. In 1849, Melville named part of the fossil material as the Kang's whale. But some of them should be fossils of poultry dragons, and fossils of sauropods should be reclassified as short-body whales. Therefore, the Kang's whale is a sub-objective synonym of short-body whales.

paragraphs.context: The Treaty of Rutland, also known as the Treaty of Ratlain or the Latrang Agreement, was a treaty signed by the Government of the Kingdom of Italy and the Holy See on February 11, 1929 to resolve the "Roman issue." This treaty was also accepted by the current Republic of Italy. During the Franco-Prussian War of 1870, the Kingdom of Italy was transferred to Napoleon III to return to the French army in Rome. The troops attacked the Papal State attached to France and occupied the city of Rome. At that time, Pope Pius IX was trapped in the Vatican, the Pope. The country is in ruin. In the face of this situation, the successive Popees were reluctant to give in and narrowed their activities to the Vatican Palace, known as the "Prison of the Vatican." The confrontation between the Holy See and Italy has lasted for 49 years. In order to resolve this dispute, since 1926, the then Prime Minister of Italy, Benito Mussolini, represented the Italian government and negotiated with the Holy See and then the Secretary of State, Peter Gaspari, on the settlement of the Roman issue. Finally, three agreements were reached and officially signed at the Latrang Palace in Rome on February 11, 1929, which became the reason for the name of the treaty. After the Rutland Treaty was signed, the Papal State officially disintegrated and was replaced by the newly established Vatican City State. On February 11, it also became the anniversary of the establishment of the Vatican City State. After the Republic of Italy changed its republic, the Constitution of the Republic of Italy, which was enacted in 1948, recognized the treaty.

Therefore, the Christ Cross is also an important symbol of Christianity. In European and American literature, the cross is generally used as a metaphor for suffering. The cross as a torture device has been popularized in the Babylonian Persian Empire, the Damascus Kingdom, the Kingdom of Judah, the Kingdom of Israel, the Carthage and the Ancient Rome. It is often used to kill rebels, pagans, slaves, and people without citizenship. In the society at the time, this form of death penalty was a taboo. Due to the large amount of resources consumed, only a few people are usually killed in a year, and the object is extremely heavy. In 337 AD, Roman Caesar Constantine ordered the ban on this torture. In addition to the annual Easter in the Philippines, the believers who wish to experience the crucifixion of Jesus also use this instrument as a ritual. The shape of the torture device is two logs that are shaped like a cross. Before the execution, the prisoner will first travel across the street carrying the cross until he walks to the execution place. The method of execution is to open the prisoner's hands horizontally, and use long nails to pass between the two bones of the forearm, nail the arm on a crossbar, and then place the crossbar on a vertical piece of wood, then put the feet together. Nailed on the straight wood, then put the cross up and let him die slowly. If the prisoner has not died before the time limit expires, the caretaker will interrupt the prisoner's legs and accelerate the death of the prisoner. Because the cruel crucifixion is unable to make the room with sufficient expansion of the lungs into the fresh air because the back is close to the cross, it is necessary to rely on the legs to prop up the whole body when breathing, so that the back slightly leaves the cross. If the legs are interrupted, the prisoner will not be able to prop up the body and eventually die due to lack of oxygen.

paragraphs.context: Since the signing of the Sino-Russian Treaty of Defamation in 1858, the land of Jiangbei was ceded to Russia, and Heilongjiang began to become the boundary of most of China and Russia. However, Sino-Soviet relations have gradually deteriorated since the Zhenbao Island incident, and the two countries’ armed forces have traveled to the Heilongjiang River, causing a critical situation in the Heilongjiang region. China and Russia successively determined the trend of the eastern boundary between the 1990s and the beginning of the 21st century. It is agreed to divide the border between the two countries with the actual control line, namely the central line of the main channel of Heilongjiang and Wusuli River. The current boundary has been determined. However, the Republic of China has never recognized the legitimacy of the Russian occupation of the 64-year-old Jiangdong.
